en: It's not especially hot today.
Let me show you around town this afternoon.
zh: 下午我带你在城里转转吧。

en: Cucumbers are related to watermelons.
zh: 黄瓜和西瓜其实是亲戚。

en: Carole is driving a rental car.
zh: 卡罗尔开的是一辆租来的车。

en: Cathy has a temper.
Do you remember what Cathy was wearing at the party?
zh: 你还记得凯茜聚会那天穿什么吗？

en: Kim is two years older than he is.
Kim plans to be a diplomat in the future.
zh: 金以后打算当个外交官。

en: Kim intends to be a diplomat in the future.
Kim is four years older than me.
Kim is four years older than I am.
Kim is dressed in a very attractive manner.
Kim is dressed very attractively.
Kim's smile is really nice.
You mean you really can't swim?
zh: 你是说你真的不会游泳？

en: You said she was kind and she certainly is, isn't she?
zh: 你说她人很好，她确实是，对吧？

en: You told us she was kind and she really is.
zh: 你跟我们说她人很好，她确实挺好的。

en: Were you home yesterday?
You didn't need to buy this book.
zh: 你其实没必要买这本书。

en: You don't need to do that.
I am happy to meet you.
I don't know who you want to see.
I don't know who you want to meet.
zh: 我不知道你想和谁见面。

en: If you had helped me, I would have succeeded.
zh: 要是你当初帮了我，我就成功了。

en: If you'd helped me, I would've succeeded.
zh: 要是你帮了我，我早成功了。

en: By the time you get back, I'll be gone.
zh: 等你回来的时候，我已经走了。

en: I didn't know you could cook this well.
zh: 我不知道你厨艺这么好。

en: I didn't know that you were such a good cook.
zh: 我不知道你做饭这么好吃。

en: I didn't know that you could cook this well.
zh: 我不知道你做饭这么拿手。

en: I didn't know you were so good at cooking.
zh: 我不知道你这么擅长做饭。

en: I didn't know that you were so good at cooking.
zh: 我不知道你做饭这么厉害。

en: I was absent from school yesterday.
I didn't go to school yesterday.
I didn't know anything about that until yesterday.
zh: 直到昨天我才知道那件事。

en: It was he that broke the window yesterday.
zh: 昨天的窗户是他打破的。

en: A Mr. Williams came to see you yesterday.
zh: 昨天有个姓威廉姆斯的先生来找你。

en: A person named Williams came to see you yesterday.
zh: 昨天有个叫威廉姆斯的人来找你。

en: Turn him down once and for all.
Foxes are wild animals.
I'm sure that he'll get angry.
You must've been working too hard.
zh: 你一定是工作太辛苦了。

en: The teacher will get angry for sure.
In all probability, we'll arrive before them.
zh: 我们很有可能在他们之前赶到。

en: In all probability, we'll arrive before they do.
zh: 很大可能我们会比他们先到。

en: It'll definitely rain.
It'll rain for sure.
It must've slipped my mind.
Are you able to play the guitar?
Who's playing the guitar?
The boy playing the guitar is my younger brother.
zh: 那个弹吉他的男孩是我弟弟。

en: Gandhi was shot dead.
The poor old man became so thin that now he's just skin and bones.
zh: 那个可怜的老头瘦得只剩皮包骨头了。

en: Please introduce me to a cute girl.
zh: 给我介绍个可爱的女孩子吧。

en: I don't know anything about their relationship.
zh: 我对他们的关系一点都不了解。

en: Carlos turned around.
If you had a million yen, what would you do with it?
zh: 如果你有一百万日元，你会怎么花？

en: Don't touch the glass.
I can't stand being made fun of.
One roll of color film, please.
Please give me batteries for a camera.
I'll have to send my camera out for repair.
zh: 我得把相机拿去修一下。

en: I forgot to put film in the camera.
zh: 我忘了往相机里装胶卷了。

en: This tastes moldy.
Is it really bad?
Canada has a cold climate.
Dinosaurs once ruled the earth.
At one time, there was a bridge here.
There were once poor farmers in that village.
zh: 那个村子里以前住着贫穷的农民。

en: He looked small next to my heavyset father.
zh: 他站在我那魁梧的父亲旁边显得很瘦小。

en: Don't be disappointed.
Don't lose heart!
It's frozen hard.
There is a gas station is one kilometer ahead.
zh: 前面一公里有个加油站。

en: He didn't need to bring an umbrella.
It wasn't necessary for him to bring an umbrella.
I've lost my umbrella. I have to buy a new one.
zh: 我的伞丢了，得买把新的。

en: Leave your umbrella at the front door.
I can't tell a frog from a toad.
Let's make believe that we're cowboys.
zh: 咱们假装自己是牛仔吧。

en: Can I pay with a credit card?
zh: 我可以用信用卡付钱吗？

en: Who's hiding behind the curtain?
I apologize.
I'm sorry to interrupt you while you're talking.
I'm sorry to disturb you while you're talking.
zh: 抱歉在你说话的时候打扰你。

en: Pardon me for interrupting you.
Pardon me for interrupting.
Can I talk to you?
I have something I want to say to you.
We got this chair for nothing because the lady next door didn't want it anymore.
zh: 这把椅子是白拿的，因为隔壁那邻居不要了。

en: I'm afraid that I can't help you.
I am pleased to see you.
I'm glad to make your acquaintance.
May I ask your name?
What did you say your name was?
zh: 你刚才说你叫什么来着？

en: May I ask you for your name and address?
zh: 可以告诉我你的姓名和地址吗？

en: Write your name and address, please.
zh: 请写下你的姓名和地址。

en: I thought that you might've just forgotten.
zh: 我还以为你只是忘了呢。

en: I thought you might've just forgotten.
My mother left me a message.
How's your mother?
Suddenly, my mother started singing.
I hope your mother gets well soon.
zh: 希望你妈妈早点好起来。

en: Mom, can I go swimming?
Mama, is it okay if I go swimming?
Mommy, may I go swimming?
Please reply.
Since I haven't received an answer, I was wondering if maybe my mail never got delivered to you.
zh: 一直没收到你的回复，我在想是不是我的邮件没寄到。

en: The quality of rice is getting worse.
zh: 这米的质量越来越差了。

en: Are you hungry?
Hungry?
I'm very hungry.
I am very hungry.
I'm terribly hungry.
I'm really hungry!
When you're hungry, anything tastes good.
zh: 肚子饿的时候，吃什么都香。

en: I am full.
I'm stuffed.
My father participated in a cooking contest and came in first.
zh: 我爸参加了一个厨艺比赛，拿了第一名。

en: My father has a habit of reading the newspaper before breakfast.
zh: 我爸有早饭前看报纸的习惯。

en: When my father found out that I've been going out with Nimrod Nick, he got very angry.
zh: 当我爸发现我一直和 Nimrod Nick 约会时，他非常生气。

en: My father is shaving in the bathroom.
zh: 我爸在卫生间刮胡子呢。

en: There's no hot water.
There is no hot water.
The weather's bad, isn't it?
Keep the change.
Won't you eat lunch with me?
Won't you eat lunch with us?
zh: 要跟我们一起吃午饭吗？

en: Would you like to eat lunch together?
Can you make do with sandwiches for lunch?
zh: 午饭凑合吃点三明治行吗？

en: I'll pick you up at noon.
It's lunch time.
It's time to eat lunch.
Please bring me a cup of tea.
Did you get the package that I sent you?
zh: 我给你寄的包裹收到了吗？

en: All you have to do is sweep the floor.
You're always singing.
Your heart is reaching out for help.
I saw the picture of the fish you caught.
zh: 我看到你钓的那条鱼的照片了。

en: If you act like a child, you'll be treated like a child.
zh: 你要是表现得像个孩子，别人就会把你当孩子看。

en: You're drunk!
I'm leaving first.
I'm leaving, please excuse me.
After you.
Please be quiet.
Thanks for your help.
Thanks for your trouble.
Thanks a lot for the invitation.
Let's eat sushi.
Is it OK if I drink alcohol?
May I drink alcohol?
No drinkers allowed.
People who drink alcoholic beverages are not allowed to enter.
Do you drink?
I will help you.
I'll help you.
I will help.
I'll help you do that.
I'll help you out.
I'll help.
Can you tell me where the restroom is?
zh: 能告诉我洗手间在哪儿吗？

en: I'm not disturbing you, am I?
Sorry for the interruption.
Do you have kids?
Do you have any kids?
Please be seated.
I'll help you if you're in trouble.
zh: 你要是遇到麻烦，我会帮你的。

en: I wish you all the best.
Understanding one another is important.
Did you call?
Thank you for coming to see me off.
Thank you for seeing me off.
Well done!
Bravo!
Well done.
I have lots of money.
I don't have a lot of money, but I get along somehow.
zh: 我没什么钱，但日子还过得去。

en: I don't want any money.
If she continues to live with a man she doesn't love for his money, the day will come when she will despair and be in dire straits.
zh: 如果她为了钱继续和不爱的男人生活，早晚有一天她会绝望并陷入困境。

en: I've run short of money.
I can't buy it because I have no money.
I can't buy it because I don't have any money.
If I had had enough money, I would have bought that computer.
zh: 如果我当时钱够，我就买那台电脑了。

en: If I'd had enough money, I would've bought that computer.
zh: 要是那时我有足够的钱，我就买那台电脑了。

en: We have a parking lot for customers.
Is there a doctor on board?
Since there were no customers, we closed the shop early.
zh: 因为没客人，我们就早点打烊了。

en: There were no customers, so we closed the shop early.
zh: 没客人，所以我们就提早关门了。

en: Could you bring us the bill, please?
I'm very happy to see you.
It's a pleasure to meet you.
You must see that the cakes do not burn.
zh: 你得盯着点，别把蛋糕烤糊了。

en: Pass the salt.
I've heard quite a lot about you.
zh: 我听过不少关于你的事。

en: No sooner said than done.
I'd like an orange juice.
Orange juice or champagne?
I'm going to be on that train, too.
Aren't I right?
Are you able to play organ?
The Olympic Games take place every four years.
zh: 奥运会每四年举办一次。

en: Holland is a small country.
It doesn't matter where you go in Holland, you'll see windmills.
zh: 在荷兰，不管你去哪儿，都能看到风车。

en: No matter where you go in Holland, you'll see windmills.
zh: 无论你在荷兰去哪儿，都能看到风车。

en: Why, is she weeping for joy?
Any book will be okay as long as it is interesting.
zh: 只要有意思，什么书都行。

en: It was raining into the bargain.
I shouldn't have told you anything.
His aunt's apple pie was delicious, so he had a second helping.
zh: 他婶婶做的苹果派太好吃了，所以他又来了一份。

en: Won't you come in and have a cup of tea?
My grandmother really likes watching TV a lot.
zh: 我奶奶特别喜欢看电视。

en: My grandmother loves watching TV.
Don't make the same mistake again.
I'm famished!
I'm dying of hunger.
I'm starving.
I'm famished.
He left for London the day before yesterday.
Don't pay any attention to what your father says.
What you said doesn't make sense.
I can't agree with you.
Excuse me, but would you please open the window?
zh: 不好意思，能麻烦你开下窗户吗？

en: I'm afraid it'll rain in the afternoon.
We'll probably be away for a few days.
My uncle is slim, but my aunt is fat.
zh: 我叔叔很苗条，但我婶婶挺胖的。

en: My uncle is thin, but my aunt is fat.
zh: 我叔叔很瘦，但我婶婶挺胖的。

en: My uncle arrived unexpectedly from Kobe.
zh: 我叔叔突然从神户过来了。

en: Grandpa fell down the stairs and was seriously injured.
zh: 爷爷从楼梯上摔下来，伤得很重。

en: My grandfather speaks very slowly.
Pride cometh before a fall.
You can't tame a wolf.
Parrots imitate the words of humans.
The motor stopped.
Mr. Eliot's niece goes to a women's college.
zh: 艾略特先生的侄女上的是一所女子学院。

en: I work as Mr. Eliot's assistant.
zh: 我是艾略特先生的助手。

en: Wow, you're really in a bad mood. Don't get scrappy.
zh: 哇，你心情真差，别火气那么大。

en: Edward inherited his uncle's property.
zh: 爱德华继承了他叔叔的财产。

en: Edward inherited his uncle's estate.
zh: 爱德华继承了他叔叔的遗产。

en: Edward is younger than Robert.
What do people eat in Egypt?
Yes, it's such a nice evening.
Fine. And you?
Yes, I have a good idea.
The rumor's all over town.
You sure guessed the critical points of that teacher's exam.
zh: 你可真把那老师的考试重点给押准了。

en: A good idea came to me.
Mrs. Wood was very good at cooking.
Mr. Wood loved Linda from the bottom of his heart.
zh: 伍德先生打心底里爱着琳达。

en: Mr. Wood was like a father to Tony.
zh: 伍德先生对托尼来说就像父亲一样。

en: Mr. Wood didn't have any sons.
Mr. Wood came to the door and spoke to Tony's mother.
zh: 伍德先生走到门口，和托尼的妈妈说了几句话。

en: We'll have some guests tomorrow.
We subscribe to a newspaper.
My family subscribes to a newspaper.
This is not some cheap Izakaya, so we don't accept that customers sing loudly.
zh: 这里不是什么便宜居酒屋，我们不接受客人大声唱歌。

en: Our fridge is broken.
My daughter loves jumping rope.
Our son was killed in the war.
zh: 我们的儿子在战争中牺牲了。

en: Who's the best singer in our company?
zh: 我们公司谁唱歌最好听？

en: I never dreamed that our company would expand its business to the U.S.
zh: 我做梦也没想到我们公司会把业务扩展到美国。

en: We have ten head of cattle.
Don't you lie!
I think it's wrong to lie.
I think telling lies is wrong.
Don't lie. Be honest.
Don't lie. Tell the truth.
Don't tell lies. Tell the truth.
The rabbit hid behind the tree.
Rabbits like carrots.
Rabbits have long ears.
Mr. Wall put off going to the dentist's.
zh: 沃尔先生推迟了去看牙医。

en: What's your waist size?
The waitress put a white tablecloth on the table.
zh: 服务员在桌上铺了一块白桌布。

en: No, it is enough. I am full.
Mr. Wilson is proud of his house.
zh: 威尔逊先生为他的房子感到自豪。

en: Mr. Wilson is angry at Dennis.
zh: 威尔逊先生在生丹尼斯的气。

en: Go and see if Mr. Wilson is at home.
zh: 去看看威尔逊先生在不在家。

en: The Van Horn family was rich.
The Van Horn family was wealthy.
The Van Horn family was affluent.
The Van Horn family was prosperous.
The Van Horns are rich.
Do I have to write in ink?
He failed many times, but he had no feeling that it was a waste of time.
zh: 他失败了很多次，但他并不觉得是在浪费时间。

en: Even though he had made many mistakes, he didn't have any regrets.
zh: 尽管犯了很多错，他也没有遗憾。

en: We're very grateful to you for all the help you've given us.
zh: 非常感谢你给我们的所有帮助。

en: Nothing special.
Anything worth doing is worth doing well.
zh: 任何值得做的事都值得做好。

en: No, but I like going to watch baseball.
zh: 不，但我喜欢去看棒球赛。

en: My cousin is the second to the last person in the line.
zh: 我表弟排在队伍倒数第二个。

en: When are you going out?
When's it over?
When will you get married?
When are you going to get married?
When are you planning to get married?
When did you get married?
I don't know exactly when I'll be back.
zh: 我不确定具体什么时候回来。

en: When will you return?
When will you return home?
When will you come back?
When will you come back home?
When will you be back home?
I always walk.
Always keep your workplace organized.
zh: 办公室要随时保持整洁。

en: Come whenever you want to.
I always feel tense.
Why are you always late for school?
Why is it that you're always late for school?
zh: 为什么你上学老是迟到呢？

en: As always, he got up early in the morning and went jogging.
zh: 他还是老样子，一早就起床去慢跑了。

en: Until when will you stay in Japan?
zh: 你要在日本待到什么时候？

en: How long will you be in Japan?
I'll remember you forever.
How soon will you be able to finish that job?
When will you be able to finish that job?
zh: 那份工作你什么时候能完成？

en: Come whenever you want.
You can consult with me any time.
Come to my office any time.
Drop by my office any time.
zh: 有空随时来我办公室坐坐。

en: Once you've formed a bad habit, you can't get rid of it easily.
zh: 坏习惯一旦养成，就很难改掉了。

en: Once a bad habit is formed, it's hard to get rid of it.
zh: 坏毛病一旦养成，就很难去掉了。

en: Why the hell is he going to accept that proposal?
zh: 他到底为什么要答应那个提议啊？

en: What the hell are you doing?
Why in the world did you do that?
zh: 你到底为什么要那样做？

en: When did you see that movie?
zh: 那电影你什么时候看的？

en: When did you get here?
I'll visit you sometime in the near future.
zh: 我近期找个时间去看你。

en: I'd like to go abroad one day.
zh: 我总想哪天能出国一趟。

en: I want to go abroad someday.
Strawberries are expensive in the winter.
Strawberries sell for a high price in the winter.
zh: 草莓在冬天卖得可贵了。

en: Have you ever visited Italy?
Please move the chair. It's in the way.
zh: 劳驾把椅子挪一下，碍着路了。

en: In any case, I'll inform you when he comes.
zh: 反正他来了我就告诉你。

en: I watched the film named "The Demon's Sacrifice" with my girlfriend yesterday. She was very afraid.
zh: 昨天跟我女朋友看了部叫《恶魔的祭品》的电影，把她吓坏了。

en: She spent many days knitting a sweater for him.
zh: 她花了好几天给他织毛衣。

en: You can never be too careful.
No matter how much you might think you like curry, three days in a row is plenty.
zh: 就算你再怎么喜欢吃咖喱，连吃三天也够呛。

en: No matter how bad it gets, she won't die of that kind of sickness.
zh: 不管多严重，她也不至于死于那种病。

en: No matter how bad it gets, she won't die from that disease.
zh: 不管病情多糟，她也不至于因为那种病没命。

en: No matter how hard I try, I can't swim to that rock.
zh: 不管我怎么努力，都游不到那块礁石那儿。

en: No matter how much she eats, she never gains weight.
zh: 她不管吃多少都不长肉。

en: I hear the grass in England is green even in the winter.
zh: 听说英国的草地就算冬天也是绿的。

en: A squid has ten legs.
Is there any good medicine?
Do you have some good medicine?
Great weather, isn't it?
You found yourself a nice guy.
zh: 你找了个不错的小伙子。

en: You've found a good man.
It's going nicely!
She's a good person.
They are good people.
I'm jealous because you have a good boss.
I'm envious of you because you have a good boss.
zh: 我好羡慕你有个好老板。

en: I'll introduce you to a nice girl.
zh: 我给你介绍个不错的女孩吧。

en: I have a good idea.
That's enough.
That's a good plan.
It was a nice party. You should've come, too.
zh: 派对挺不错的，你也该来的。

en: Sure. Good luck!
"Do you speak German?" "No, I don't."
No, I don't think the weather will clear up.
zh: 不，我觉得天气不会放晴。

en: No, I didn't write it.
No, I didn't help.
No, I didn't go.
Ann has many friends.
Ann must be having a happy dream.
Ann likes chocolate very much.
Ann loves chocolate.
Ann is exceedingly fond of chocolate.
Ann is a sucker for chocolate.
zh: 安对巧克力完全没有抵抗力。

en: Ann loves chocolate more than anything.
Ann is partial to chocolate.
I can't stand that kind of politician.
Anna got married without her parents' knowledge.
zh: 安娜瞒着父母偷偷结婚了。

en: I've never seen such a large whale.
zh: 我从没见过这么大的鲸鱼。

en: I've never seen a whale that big.
zh: 我从没见过那么大的鲸鱼。

en: Anthony was respected by the Egyptians.
zh: 安东尼很受埃及人的尊敬。

en: Please show me that.
Please show me that one.
Please show me those.
That is my book.
That's my book.
Those are my CD's.
That's my CD.
That isn't an orange, either.
That's not an orange, either.
Even with all his money, he's unhappy.
zh: 就算他有那么多钱，还是不开心。

en: Even with all the money he has, he isn't happy.
zh: 即便他有再多钱，也不快乐。

en: Even with all his wealth and fame, he's unhappy.
zh: 尽管有名有利，他还是不幸福。

en: That's a student my father teaches.
That's his house.
That's a tower.
That's a great poem.
That's the fastest train in the world.
zh: 那是世界上最快的火车。

en: That's my sister's camera.
That's the building where my father works.
zh: 那是我父亲工作的那栋楼。

en: That isn't my pen.
That's not my pen.
What's that bird called?
What is the name of that bird?
What's the name of that bird?
That can't be Mary. She's in the hospital now.
zh: 那不可能是玛丽，她现在在住院呢。

en: That isn't a tiger.
That's not a tiger.
That's exactly what I wanted.
He must be the principal.
That's a pheasant.
That is a bus stop.
If you compare this to that, which is better?
zh: 把这个和那个比，哪个更好？

en: One Sunday morning George burst into the living room and said this.
zh: 一个周日的早上，乔治冲进客厅，说了这些话。

en: One morning, she unexpectedly met him on the street.
zh: 有天早上，她在街上意外碰到了他。

en: One weekend, all of the hotels in the city were full.
zh: 有个周末，城里所有的酒店都住满了。

en: What is correct in one society may be wrong in another society.
zh: 在一种社会里是对的，在另一种社会里可能就是错的。

en: A king lived in an old castle.
zh: 一位国王住在一座古堡里。

en: I'm going to meet a certain student.
He was driving the car in one rainy evening.
zh: 在一个下雨的晚上，他正开着车。

en: She was driving the car in one rainy evening.
zh: 在一个下雨的晚上，她正开着车。

en: Mr. Legros can say the alphabet backwards.
zh: 勒格罗斯先生能倒着背字母表。

en: Would you please show me your photo album?
zh: 能给我看看你的相册吗？

en: I have to find a part-time job.
The alcohol is beginning to effect his speech.
zh: 酒精开始影响他说话了。

en: Ants work hard all summer.
zh: 蚂蚁整个夏天都在辛勤工作。

en: Alice has a flower in her hair.
zh: 爱丽丝头上戴着一朵花。

en: Alice is wearing a sweet-smelling perfume.
zh: 爱丽丝身上有股很好闻的香水味。

en: Green suits Alice.
Green looks good on Alice.
I think it's strange that Alice should keep silent for such a long time.
zh: 爱丽丝竟然沉默了这么久，我觉得挺奇怪的。

en: Thank you. We'll do our best.
Thanks, I'm fine.
All things considered, my father's life was a happy one.
zh: 总的来说，我父亲这一辈子过得很幸福。

en: Considering everything, my father's life was a happy one.
zh: 考虑到方方面面，我父亲的一生是很幸福的。

en: We should have phoned ahead and reserved a table.
zh: 我们本该提前打电话订位的。

en: We should've phoned ahead and reserved a table.
zh: 我们当初要是提前打电话订座就好了。

en: You should've telephoned in advance.
zh: 你当初应该提前打电话的。

en: She doesn't seem to be an American.
zh: 她看上去不像是美国人。

en: They don't seem to be Americans.
zh: 他们看上去不像是美国人。

en: America's economy is the largest in the world.
zh: 美国的经济规模是世界第一。

en: I'm crazy about football.
The United States is next to Canada.
What is your impression of America?
What is your impression of the United States?
There are people of many different races living in America.
zh: 美国住着很多不同种族的人。

en: I don't meet him so often.
Don't expose your skin to the sun for too long.
If you worry too much, you'll go bald.
zh: 你要是愁得太多，会变秃的。

en: I didn't really feel like going out.
Don't be too hard on yourself.
Don't be discouraged just because you're not all that talented.
zh: 别因为自己没什么天赋就灰心。

en: There's not much hope.
There isn't much hope.
It seems that you're not having a good time here.
zh: 看来你在这儿过得并不开心。

en: It seems that you aren't having a good time here.
zh: 看来你在这儿过得不太开心。

en: I quarrelled with my sister because she's too kind.
zh: 我跟我姐吵了一架，因为她人太好了。

en: So much has happened, that it's as if the world turned upside down.
zh: 发生了这么多事，简直像是天翻地覆了一样。

en: He tends to get angry if you ask a lot of questions.
zh: 你要是问太多问题，他就容易生气。

en: It's similar to a duck.
The apartment building is on fire.
That old man must be insane.
Who is that old man?
That old man had been making homemade whiskey for fifty years.
zh: 那个老头儿酿了五十年的私酒。

en: That old man had been making moonshine for fifty years.
zh: 那个老头儿酿了五十年的私酒。

en: That hotel has a homey atmosphere.
zh: 那家酒店有种家的感觉。

en: Have you finished reading that book?
What did you do with that book?
Are you the one who wrote that report?
That room isn't very large.
That lady appears to be rich.
zh: 那位女士看起来挺有钱的。

en: If I'd taken that plane, I wouldn't be alive now.
zh: 我要是上了那架飞机，现在肯定没命了。

en: Had I taken that plane, I would be dead by now.
zh: 我要是坐了那班飞机，现在早就死了。

en: What does that tall man play?
zh: 那个高个子是打什么球的？

en: That tall man is Mr. Smith.
zh: 那个高个子男人是史密斯先生。

en: Look at that cat. It is Mr. Brown's.
zh: 看那只猫，是布朗先生家的。

en: It looks like those two have gotten back together.
It looks like those two have made up.
zh: 看来那两个人已经和好了。

en: How tall is that tower?
That shop has many customers.
There is nothing left to buy at that store.
zh: 那家店已经没什么可买的了。

en: You shouldn't trust that man.
That man is a heavy debtor.
zh: 那个男人欠了一屁股债。

en: That man has many debts.
Don't obey that man.
Don't obey him.
He's not the only fish in the sea.
zh: 世界上又不是只有他一个男人。

en: We couldn't go out because of the typhoon.
zh: 因为台风，我们没法出门。

en: I can't put up with that noise.
Would you please close that window?
zh: 能请你关一下那扇窗户吗？

en: I often go fishing in that river.
You may ask that teacher questions.
That baby is really not cute at all.
zh: 那个宝宝真的一点儿也不可爱。

en: That red dress suited her.
zh: 那件红裙子挺适合她的。

en: Do you know who that person is?
Who is that person?
They are longing for city life.
They must've suspected me of stealing.
zh: 他们肯定怀疑是我偷的。

en: That person's house is near the subway.
zh: 那人的家在地铁站附近。

en: Should I buy something for him?
I'm a little hesitant to ask a favor of that person.
zh: 找那个人帮忙，我有点犹豫。

en: I'm a little hesitant about asking her for a favor.
I suggest that you write him a thank-you letter.
zh: 我建议你给他写封感谢信。

en: I suggest that you write her a thank-you letter.
zh: 我建议你给她写封感谢信。

en: While they were away on vacation, their neighbors looked after the dog.
zh: 他们度假期间，邻居帮他们照看那条狗。

en: No one told me that he had failed.
No one told me that she had failed.
He can't be a poet.
How long has it been since you received a letter from him?
zh: 你多久没收到他的信了？

en: Who's that gentleman?
That boy is smart.
That boy is intelligent.
Who's that boy?
That small star is the brightest.
Who's that woman?
That woman is much older than I am.
That woman must be his wife.
zh: 那个女人肯定是他老婆。

en: That woman is his wife, I think.
zh: 我觉得那个女人是他老婆。

en: That girl wanted to become a movie star.
zh: 那个女孩想当电影明星。

en: Follow that car.
Are you going to buy that car?
Do you plan to buy that car?
When I see that play, I always cry.
zh: 每次看那出戏，我都会哭。

en: I wish I had followed his instructions at that time.
zh: 我要是当时听他的就好了。

en: Does that clock work?
I haven't seen him since.
zh: 从那以后我就没见过他了。

en: That time was really fun.
His health has been getting worse since the accident.
zh: 自从那次事故后，他的身体就越来越差了。

en: That accident is a good example of his carelessness.
zh: 那次事故充分说明了他有多粗心。

en: That boy isn't as mischievous as we thought he would be.
zh: 那个男孩没我们想的那么淘气。

en: This child's mother is an announcer.
zh: 这孩子的妈妈是个播音员。

en: If my boy had not been killed in the traffic accident, he would be a college student now.
zh: 要是我的孩子没在那场车祸里去世，他现在已经是大学生了。

en: How tall is that mountain?
We're going to climb that mountain.
Are you finished with that magazine?
What happened at that intersection?
zh: 那个路口发生什么事了？

en: That lake looks like an ocean.
zh: 那个湖看着像大海一样。

en: Where did you get those old coins?
zh: 你从哪弄到的那些旧硬币？

en: That dog is really old!
My leg was bitten by that dog.
Who's that standing in front of that building?
zh: 站在那栋楼前的那个人是谁？

en: Who's the person standing in front of that building?
zh: 站在那栋楼前面的那个人是谁？

en: It was Mr. Smith that taught me how to use that machine.
zh: 是史密斯先生教我怎么用那台机器的。

en: I've seen that face somewhere before.
zh: 我以前在哪见过那张脸。

en: When I think about those students, it gives me a headache.
zh: 一想到那些学生我就头疼。

en: In order to see that picture better, I want to get a little closer.
zh: 为了把那幅画看清楚点，我想凑近些。

en: In order to get a better look at that picture, I'd like to get a little closer.
zh: 为了能看清那幅画，我想再靠近一点。

en: Little by little, I'm beginning to like that painting.
zh: 我一点点开始喜欢上那幅画了。

en: That flower has a strong smell.
That Kabuki actor is very well known amongst young people.
zh: 那个歌舞伎演员在年轻人里很有名。

en: Every time I hear that song, I think of my high school days.
zh: 每次听到那首歌，我都会想起高中时光。

en: That house is mine.
That house is haunted.
We had a lot of thunder that summer.
zh: 那年夏天雷阵雨特别多。

en: Look at the cat that's on that roof.
Look at the cat on that roof.
You should've seen the movie.
zh: 你当时真该看看那部电影。

en: Look at that boy who's swimming.
zh: 你看那个正在游泳的男孩。

en: There are various kinds of candy in that bowl.
zh: 那个碗里有各种各样的糖果。

en: No one lives in that building.
That hamburger really was delicious.
Look at that handsome boy.
Whose is that notebook?
The woman you were talking to at that time was my sister.
zh: 当时和你说话的那个女人是我姐姐。

en: If that guitar weren't so expensive, I could buy it.
zh: 要是那把吉他没那么贵，我就买下了。

en: Excuse me, which way is the post office?
zh: 打扰一下，请问邮局怎么走？

en: I think you need to go in person.
zh: 我觉得你得亲自去一趟。

en: Let me introduce you to Mr. Tanaka.
zh: 我给你介绍一下田中先生。

en: I'm sorry that I misunderstood you.
Do you know the man that's staring at you?
zh: 你认识那个盯着你看的男人吗？

en: Do you know the man staring at you?
zh: 你认识那个正在盯着你瞧的男人吗？

en: Do you know the man who's staring at you?
zh: 你认识那个盯着你看的男人吗？

en: I didn't want to surprise you.
You don't need to come.
You must be sad since you lost one of your friends.
zh: 失去了一个朋友，你一定很难过吧。

en: You're exaggerating the problem.
You'll be busy tomorrow, won't you?
Can you go to the seaside tomorrow?
How many times a year do you go skiing?
Do you study every day?
You are very good at sewing.
Can you really swim?
You're really wonderful.
I think you are a really nice person.
You have a keen sense of direction.
Do you think she's attractive?
You are taller than she is.
You told me that she was kind and she really is.
zh: 你跟我说她人很好，她确实是这样。

en: You can swim much better than he can.
You must take his state of health into account.
zh: 你必须考虑到他的健康状况。

en: You should listen to his advice.
Do you understand what he's saying?
Do you know his older brother?
What do you know about him?
You shouldn't have told him about the plan.
zh: 你不该把计划告诉他的。

en: You're sharp.
Are you related to the Nagashimas?
zh: 你和长岛家有亲戚关系吗？

en: You don't need to pay for your lunch.
Are you Chinese or Japanese?
zh: 你是中国人还是日本人？

en: With whom did you talk?
Who are you?
You're so beautiful!
What did you specialize in at university?
zh: 你大学学的是什么专业？

en: You run.
You are completely wrong.
Keep in mind that you're not as young as you used to be.
zh: 别忘了你已经不年轻了。

en: You don't need to prepare a formal speech.
zh: 你不需要准备正式的发言。

en: There's no need for you to prepare a formal speech.
zh: 你没必要准备正式的演讲。

en: Are you good at math?
You seem to be a kind person.
zh: 你看起来是个挺善良的人。

en: You seem to be a kind man.
zh: 你看起来是个挺好的男人。

en: Have you gotten settled into your new house yet?
You should prepare for the future.
You shouldn't go out.
You've missed an important clue.
zh: 你错过了一个重要的线索。

en: You must get off at the next station.
Do you sometimes give your younger sister money?
zh: 你有时会给你妹妹钱吗？

en: I'm afraid that you misunderstood me.
You seem to have mistaken me for my older brother.
zh: 你好像把我认成我哥了。

en: You have more energy than I do.
You have more energy than me.
You're taller than me.
You're taller than I am.
You aren't as short as I am.
You aren't as short as me.
You are twice as strong as I am.
You are twice as strong as me.
Do you know us?
Can you supply me with everything I need?
zh: 你能提供我需要的所有东西吗？

en: You're the only person I can trust.
zh: 你是我唯一可以信任的人。

en: Do you believe that there's life after death?
zh: 你相信人死后还有来生吗？

en: You must work.
You don't have to take your umbrella with you.
You should've seen that movie last night.
zh: 你昨晚真该看看那部电影。

en: You've changed since I saw you last year.
zh: 自从去年见面，你变了不少。

en: You only have to answer the first question.
zh: 你只需要回答第一个问题。

en: You're not busy now, are you?
What would you like to do today?
What do you want to do today?
What do you have to do now?
What have you been up to?
You'd better go.
Do you wish to go?
It would be good for you to study eagerly.
You're too young to get married.
You're going out with a Keio student, aren't you?
zh: 你在跟庆应大学的学生交往吧？

en: You're dating a Keio student, aren't you?
zh: 你在跟庆应的学生谈恋爱吧？

en: What do you plan to do on Friday?
What're you going to do on Friday?
You need to hurry.
Where did you spend your vacation?
Your memory is good.
Your face is pale.
You should have your eyes examined.
You should get your eyes examined.
You should get your eyes checked.
zh: 你该去检查一下眼睛了。

en: You'd better have your eyes examined.
You have to give three months' rent as a deposit.
zh: 你得交三个月房租当押金。

en: What're you going to do during your summer vacation?
What are you going to do for summer vacation?
How many pens do you have?
Where are you bound?
Where are you heading?
What are you?
What're you trying to do?
What are you interested in?
How pretty you are!
Have you ever been to Okinawa?
Have you ever been in Okinawa?
You're not leaving Japan for good, are you?
zh: 你不是要彻底离开日本了吧？

en: You're not a doctor.
Are you a doctor?
You have wanted to go there for a long time, haven't you?
You're a bad boy.
You've never been to Paris, have you?
Do you commute to school by bus?
Are you going to school by bus?
What kind of Japanese food do you like?
What is your favorite sport?
zh: 你最喜欢的运动是什么？

en: How much money have you obtained?
What newspaper do you subscribe to?
Where did you see that woman?
zh: 你是在哪儿见到那个女人的？

en: Who did you meet?
You'd better stop smoking.
How did you get such a large amount of money?
How generous you are to give me so much money.
zh: 你可真大方，给我这么多钱。

en: Did you make it by yourself?
You should've kept it secret.
Do you remember that baffling murder case?
zh: 你还记得那个离奇的谋杀案吗？

en: Don't swim in that pond.
You shouldn't swim in that pond.
zh: 你不该在那个池塘里游泳。

en: Are you in favor of the new law?
You must observe those rules.
You should've seen the picture.
All you have to do is go there.
The only thing you need to do is go there.
zh: 你唯一要做的就是去那儿。

en: You don't need to go there.
You'll soon get used to Japanese food.
zh: 你很快就会习惯日本菜的。

en: You will soon get used to Japanese food.
zh: 你很快就会适应日本料理的。

en: You'd better send for the doctor at once.
You do not have to answer this question.
zh: 你可以不用回答这个问题。

en: You don't need to answer this question.
zh: 你不需要回答这个问题。

en: You should wait here.
You don't need to stand up.
How many times a month do you write a letter to your mother?
zh: 你一个月给你妈写几封信？

en: You should help your father.
Do you like green tea or black tea?
Which do you like, green tea or black tea?
zh: 绿茶和红茶，你喜欢哪种？

en: You're always complaining.
Do you always drink coffee with your breakfast?
zh: 你吃早饭的时候总是喝咖啡吗？

en: Would you like to travel to the United States?
Do you know that boy who's crying?
zh: 你认识那个在哭的小男孩吗？

en: You must've been surprised to meet your teacher in such a place.
zh: 在这种地方遇到老师，你一定很吃惊吧。

en: Do you think the weather will be fine tomorrow?
zh: 你觉得明天天气会好吗？

en: Do you think tomorrow's weather will be good?
zh: 你觉得明天天气会不错吗？

en: Do you think tomorrow will be a nice day?
zh: 你觉得明天会是个好天气吗？

en: Do you think we'll have good weather tomorrow?
zh: 你觉得明天咱们这儿天气会好吗？

en: Do you think it will be nice out tomorrow?
zh: 你觉得明天外面天气会好吗？

en: You came home at 5:00.
How many books a month do you read?
How many books do you read per month?
Are you going to work until 10:00?
Do you plan to work until 10:00?
Do you enjoy studying?
Do you know the town where he was born?
zh: 你知道他出生的那个小镇吗？

en: You should go to bed early.
What are you up to?
About how many times a month do you wash your car?
zh: 你大概一个月洗几次车？

en: Can you play tennis?
You should keep in touch with Mr. Smith.
zh: 你应该和史密斯先生保持联系。

en: I remember the dream I had when I slept in your arms.
zh: 我还记得睡在你怀里时做的那个梦。

en: A Mr. Jones came while you were out.
zh: 你出去的时候，有个叫琼斯先生的人来过。

en: A person named Jones came while you were out.
zh: 你不在的时候，一个叫琼斯的人来找过你。

en: We'll reconfirm your reservation for you.
zh: 我们会帮您重新确认预订。

en: I'm sorry that I opened your mail by mistake.
zh: 不好意思，我一不小心把你的信拆了。

en: Had it not been for your courage, you would have been killed.
zh: 要不是你勇敢，你早就没命了。

en: If you hadn't been so brave, you'd probably have been killed.
zh: 要是你没那么勇敢，可能早就没命了。

en: Please tell me how to spell your name.
zh: 请告诉我你的名字怎么拼。

en: When did your daughter become an adult?
zh: 你女儿是什么时候成年的？

en: It's your book.
I didn't know that you were sick, so I didn't visit you in the hospital.
zh: 我不知道你生病了，所以没去医院看你。

en: From the look on your face, I can tell that you have good news.
zh: 看你的样子就知道你有好消息。

en: What time does your plane leave?
When does your plane depart?
Please write down your date of your birth.
What is your age?
Could you please reschedule the meeting at a time that is convenient for you?
zh: 能不能请你把会议改到你方便的时间？

en: If it hadn't been for your advice, he would have been ruined.
zh: 要不是因为你的建议，他就毁了。

en: Your manners aren't very good.
The address you're looking for is very near the city hall.
zh: 你找的那个地址就在市政厅附近。

en: Could you elaborate on your new theory?
zh: 你能详细说说你的新理论吗？

en: How old is your oldest son?
Without your help, he would have been ruined.
zh: 如果没有你的帮助，他就毁了。

en: Without your help, we couldn't have done it.
zh: 要是没有你的帮助，我们肯定搞不定。

en: Without your help, I couldn't have gotten over that difficult situation.
zh: 如果没有你的帮助，我没法度过那个难关。

en: Without your help, I couldn't have ridden out that crisis.
zh: 要不是你帮忙，我肯定挺不过那个难关。

en: Had it not been for your help, I would have failed.
zh: 要不是你帮忙，我就失败了。

en: Without your help, we wouldn't have finished in time.
zh: 要是没有你帮忙，我们就没法准时完成了。

en: I've received your letter.
Your hands need to be washed.
You need to wash your hands.
Would you lend your dictionary to me?
zh: 能把你的字典借我一下吗？

en: What time does your watch say it is now?
What is your sister doing now?
What's your sister doing now?
Your job isn't easy.
Does it snow much in your country?
Who's your favorite writer?
We're grateful to you for your help.
What you're saying is absolutely wrong.
What you say is true.
I'm worried about your health.
What is your blood type?
What's your blood type?
Without your encouragement, I would have given up this plan.
zh: 要不是你的鼓励，我早就放弃这个计划了。

en: Please give me your picture so I don't forget how you look.
zh: 给我张你的照片吧，免得我忘了你长什么样。

en: Will you sell me your house?
Whose house is across from yours?
What do you call your father at home?
zh: 你在家里怎么称呼你爸？

en: Would you lend me your pencil?
Who's your favourite TV star?
zh: 你最喜欢的电视明星是谁？

en: I've lost your email address.
zh: 我把你邮箱地址弄丢了。

en: Would you mind putting a link on your web page to our company's web site?
zh: 方便在你的网页上加个我们公司的链接吗？

en: Could I get your autograph?
I hope that your parents will allow us to get married.
zh: 我希望你爸妈能同意咱们结婚。

en: I hope your parents will allow us to get married.
zh: 希望你爸妈能让我们结婚。

en: I will never forget you.
zh: 我永远都不会忘记你的。

en: How many students are there in your class?
Where is your father?
We're glad to help you.
I'll do what you ask.
zh: 你让我做什么我就做什么。

en: I can't understand what you said at all.
zh: 我完全听不懂你在说什么。

en: What you said makes absolutely no sense to me.
zh: 你说的我一点儿都听不明白。

en: We're all looking forward to your coming.
You can say that again.
I can't do without your advice.
zh: 没有你的建议，我真不行。

en: I'll give you a book.
We'd like you to join our company.
zh: 我们希望你能加入我们公司。

en: A Mr. Ono called to see you.
zh: 有个叫小野的先生来找过你。

en: A person named Ono has dropped by to see you.
zh: 有个叫小野的人来看你了。

en: There's someone here who wants to see you.
I haven't kept any secrets from you.
I ask you a question.
What takes you only three days, takes me three weeks.
zh: 你只要三天就能搞定的事，我得花三个星期。

en: May I give you some advice?
I should've told you everything earlier.
zh: 我该早点把所有事都告诉你的。

en: I can't lend this book to you.
I am much obliged to you.
You're the last person I would've expected to see here.
zh: 真没想到会在这儿碰到你。

en: A person who wants to speak with you has arrived downstairs.
It was a pleasure meeting you, Mr. Tamori.
zh: 田森先生，很高兴认识你。

en: There's a woman as wants to see you.
He is very kind, just like you.
zh: 他人特别好，就像你一样。

en: Should I go with you?
I'm glad to have this opportunity to work with you.
zh: 很高兴能有机会和你一起工作。

en: I'm glad to have this opportunity to speak to you.
zh: 很高兴能有机会和你聊聊。

en: I saw you cooking.
If you could come, I'd be really happy.
zh: 你要是能来，我就太开心了。

en: I'm glad you're coming.
I'm glad that you can come.
I'm glad you were able to come.
Who'll look after your cat while you are away?
zh: 你不在的时候，谁来照顾你的猫？

en: I'm surprised that you don't know about their marriage.
zh: 你居然不知道他们结婚了，真让人意外。

en: The camera you bought is better than mine.
It's your turn to deal.
We're hoping for your quick recovery.
Without your help, I would have drowned.
zh: 要不是你帮我，我早就淹死了。

en: Without your help, I would've drowned.
zh: 要不是你帮我，我肯定淹死了。

en: Without your help, I would've been unable to do it.
zh: 如果没有你帮忙，我根本做不成。

en: If you could assist me, it would be a great help.
zh: 你要是能帮帮我，那就帮大忙了。

en: I was afraid you had failed.
I will accept the work, provided you help me.
zh: 只要你帮我，我就接这个活儿。

en: I don't know anything about him except what you told me.
zh: 除了你跟我说的，关于他我什么都不知道。

en: The magazine you lent me is very interesting.
zh: 你借给我的那本杂志挺有意思的。

en: What is the total amount of money you spent?
I'll recommend him as chairman, whether you are in favor of it or not.
zh: 不管你同不同意，我都要推荐他当主席。

en: The man that you saw there yesterday was Mr. Brown.
zh: 你昨天在那儿见到的那个人是布朗先生。

en: If you don't go, I won't go either.
I'm in love with you.
No matter what you say, I'm convinced that I'm right.
zh: 不管你怎么说，我还是觉得我是对的。

en: No matter what you say, I'm convinced I'm right.
zh: 随你怎么说，我都认定我是对的。

en: I know what you're scheming to do.
zh: 我知道你在打什么主意。

en: No matter what you may say, I won't change my mind.
zh: 无论你说什么，我都不会改变主意的。

en: I'll lend you any book that I have, as long as you keep it clean.
zh: 只要你能保持干净，我的书随便你借。

en: What you are thinking about moving doesn't need to be moved.
zh: 你想搬的那个东西没必要搬。

en: Who's your favorite TV star?
zh: 你最喜欢的电视明星是谁？

en: I've been hoping to hear from you.
zh: 我一直盼着你的消息呢。

en: If you'd left earlier, you would've caught the train.
zh: 你要是早点出发，就能赶上火车了。

en: You don't need to be afraid of making mistakes.
I'm surprised to see you smoking; you didn't use to.
zh: 真没想到你竟然抽烟，你以前不抽的。

en: I'm afraid that your request for a pay raise was turned down again.
zh: 恐怕你涨工资的要求又被拒绝了。

en: You should do all you can to help your neighbors.
zh: 你该尽力帮帮你的邻居。

en: Which of you will try it first?
I wasn't aware that you were feeling that bad.
zh: 我之前没意识到你那时感觉那么难受。

en: I wasn't aware that you were feeling so bad.
zh: 我之前不知道你竟然这么难受。

en: It's strange that you don't know anything about that matter.
zh: 那件事你竟然一点都不知道，真奇怪。

en: I should like to see the trees from which you picked these apples.
zh: 我想去看看你摘这些苹果的那几棵树。

en: It's worth your time to read this book.
zh: 这本书很值得你花时间去读。

en: I would like to express my gratitude for what you have done for this town.
zh: 我想为你为这个小镇所做的一切表达我的谢意。

en: I'm sorry that you're leaving us.
I know that you are hiding yourself behind the curtain.
zh: 我知道你正躲在窗帘后面。

en: I know you're hiding behind the curtain.
zh: 我知道你躲在窗帘后面。

en: I know that you're hiding behind the curtain.
zh: 我知道你正躲在窗帘后面呢。

en: It's a shame that you're not coming.
You will be missed by your friends when you're gone.
zh: 你走之后，你的朋友们会想念你的。

en: You'll be missed by your friends when you're gone.
zh: 你走之后，朋友们会想念你的。

en: Did you and Joan have a fight?
Did you say you had a fight with Joan?
zh: 你是说你和琼吵架了吗？

en: How many hours left till arrival?
I will tell the rest tomorrow.
I walked around aimlessly.
zh: 我漫无目的地四处走了走。

en: I baked an apple pie.
I baked some apple pies.
Over there is the person I've been waiting for.
zh: 那边那个就是我一直在等的人。

en: That's the person I've been waiting for.
zh: 那位就是我一直在等的人。

en: There were holes here and there.
The area was quiet.
The surrounding area was very quiet.
I spent 3000 yen on a new CD.
zh: 我花了三千日元买了一张新CD。

en: Mr. Adams was foolish to agree to the proposal.
zh: 亚当斯先生同意那个提议真是太傻了。

en: That place's food is delicious and their prices are low. However, their location isn't good.
zh: 那家店的东西挺好吃，价格也便宜，不过位置不太好。

en: Let's go drink a cup of coffee at that coffee shop over there.
zh: 咱们去那边那家咖啡店喝杯咖啡吧。

en: Let's drink some coffee or something at that coffee shop over there.
zh: 咱们去那边那家咖啡馆喝点咖啡什么的吧。

en: Can we sit at the table over there?
zh: 我们能坐那边那个桌子吗？

en: Who's that woman standing over there?
zh: 站在那边的那个女人是谁？

en: The man standing over there is Mr. Smith.
zh: 站在那边的那个男人是史密斯先生。

en: You see that tall building over there, don't you?
zh: 你看到那边那栋高楼了吧？

en: It is rumored there are treasures hidden there.
Look at the girl over there.
Let's rent bicycles over there.
zh: 咱们在那儿租几辆自行车吧。

en: What's going on there now?
What were you doing there?
I'll visit you at your office tomorrow.
zh: 我明天去你办公室找你。

en: What'll you be doing at this time tomorrow?
zh: 明天这个时候你在干嘛呢？

en: I will speak with you tomorrow.
I'll stay at home tomorrow.
Men always walk in front of women in this country.
zh: 在这个国家，男人总是走在女人前面。

en: A sea separates Ireland and England.
zh: 一片海洋把爱尔兰和英格兰分开了。

en: Unfortunately, my mother isn't at home.
I'm sorry, my father's not here.
Unfortunately, my father isn't at home.
zh: 遗憾的是，我父亲不在家。

en: I'm afraid that we don't have any left.
zh: 恐怕我们这儿已经没有剩的了。

en: Unfortunately, she didn't come.
Unfortunately, I don't have any money with me now.
zh: 挺不凑巧的，我现在身上没带钱。

en: I'm afraid that I can't accept your invitation.
zh: 恐怕我没法接受你的邀请。

en: Unfortunately, she is absent.
Unfortunately, I left my homework at home.
zh: 真倒霉，我把作业忘家里了。

en: He's a wolf in sheep's clothing.
I don't like him.
I don't get along with him.
He's the black sheep of the family.
That guy annoys me.
He really makes me angry.
I'll choke the life out of him.
I'll use magic on him and turn him into a frog.
zh: 我要对他施法，把他变成一只青蛙。

en: He stole my wallet.
He's trying to get on his boss's good side.
Now that's scary!
Man, I'm hungry.
Gosh, I'm hungry.
Oh! Really?
Oh, the electricity has gone off.
I'll pay by Visa.
USSR stands for Union of Soviet Socialist Republics.
zh: USSR 是苏维埃社会主义共和国联盟的缩写。
tokens: 苏维埃社会主义共和国

en: Do you like science fiction movies?
I wonder if it would be possible for you to introduce me to Mr. Harrison of PC Interactive Co. Ltd.
zh: 不知能否请你介绍我认识 PC 互动有限公司的哈里森先生？

en: General Motors laid off 76,000 of its workers.
zh: 通用汽车裁掉了七万六千名员工。

en: GE announced the acquisition of the Lake company for $30 million.
zh: 通用电气宣布以 3000 万美元收购了 Lake 公司。

en: CO₂ has a lot to do with the so-called greenhouse effect.
zh: 二氧化碳和所谓的温室效应有很大关系。

en: Where is the accent on the word 'Australia?'
Mr. Gardner of the ABC Corporation is staying at the Marriott Hotel from February 20th to the 27th, and would like very much to meet with you.
zh: ABC 公司的加德纳先生 2 月 20 号到 27 号住在万豪酒店，他很想见见你。

en: It wants five minutes to nine.
It was already after 8 o'clock, so we called it a day.
zh: 已经过八点了，所以我们就收工了。

en: Wake me up at eight.
If you go around eight, you might meet him.
zh: 如果你八点左右去，可能会碰到他。

en: I'll call at seven.
I will start working on July the first.
Do you have a seven-yen stamp?
Here is the final agenda for the meeting on June 16th.
zh: 这是 6 月 16 号会议的最终议程。

en: Please wait five minutes.
Wait five minutes, please.
If you come back by five, you may go.
zh: 如果你五点前能回来，你就可以走。

en: Do you think it's impossible to finish this by five o'clock?
zh: 你觉得五点前完不成吗？

en: May fifth is Children's Day.
I'll give you five dollars.
He died when he was 54 years old.
She died when she was 54 years old.
She died at the age of 54.
He died at the age of 54.
That's 50 yen.
Would it be possible to set up a meeting with us on April fifth or sixth?
zh: 不知能否安排在 4 月 5 号或 6 号跟我们见个面？

en: It's not necessary to write more than 400 words.
You don't need to write more than 400 words.
zh: 你不需要写超过 400 字。

en: More than 40 percent of students go on to university.
zh: 超过百分之四十的学生会上大学。

en: More than 40 percent of the students go on to university.
zh: 超过百分之四十的学生会继续上大学。

en: I saw him three years ago.
I have been constipated for three days.
Call her at 3.
Let's make it 3:00.
Let's make it three o'clock.
I would greatly appreciate it if we could change our appointment to March 6 at 3:00 pm.
zh: 如果能把预约改到3月6号下午三点，那就太感谢了。

en: The third power of 3 is 27.
Five plus three is eight.
Five and three is eight.
You should've left half an hour earlier.
zh: 你本来应该早半小时出发的。

en: I was kept waiting nearly half an hour.
zh: 我被晾在那儿等了快半个小时。

en: Let's begin on page 30.
If you agree to buy 3,000 of them, we'll give you a 3 percent discount.
zh: 如果你愿意买三千个，我们可以给你打九七折。

en: Don't ever lie to me again.
Quite a few people have two cars.
Two men are checking on what's wrong with the car.
zh: 两个男的正在检查车出了什么毛病。

en: Two men are trying to figure out what's wrong with the car.
zh: 两个男的正在琢磨车出什么问题了。

en: Two men kept guard.
One of the two has to go.
zh: 两个人里必须得走一个。

en: Two o'clock would be OK.
Can we meet on February the 28th, around 3:00 p.m.?
zh: 我们能在2月28号下午三点左右见个面吗？

en: How about February 28th around 3:00 pm?
I'm free all afternoon on February 27th.
zh: 我2月27号整个下午都有空。

en: On February 14th, Americans celebrate Valentine's Day.
Some kind of party upstairs kept me up until one last night.
zh: 昨晚楼上不知道在开什么派对，吵得我一点才睡。

en: Two pictures overlapped.
There's not much difference between the two opinions.
zh: 这两种意见没啥大区别。

en: There isn't much difference between the two opinions.
zh: 这两个观点差不了多少。

en: Out of twenty students, only one had read the book.
zh: 二十个学生里，只有一个读过这本书。

en: I plan to finish it in two or three minutes.
zh: 我打算两三分钟内把它弄完。

en: I'll finish it in two or three minutes.
I plan on finishing that in two or three minutes.
zh: 我打算两三分钟就把那事儿解决。

en: Is ten thousand yen enough?
There are four seasons in a year - spring, summer, fall, and winter.
How many times a year do you go scuba diving?
I'll see to it that you get a raise after the first year.
zh: 我保证一年后给你涨工资。

en: I worked on the farm all day.
zh: 我在农场干了一整天活。

en: I walk twenty miles a day.
It's impossible to see all the sights in Rome in one day.
zh: 一天之内逛完罗马所有的景点是不可能的。

en: It's impossible to see Rome in a day.
zh: 一天是不可能逛完罗马的。

en: Do you have one-day tours?
I never dreamed that I would win first prize.
zh: 我做梦也没想到能拿一等奖。

en: I never dreamt that I would win first prize.
zh: 我从没想过我会得头奖。

en: She never dreamed that she could win first prize.
zh: 她做梦都没想到自己能拿第一名。

en: Ten million yen will be enough for the project.
zh: 这个项目有一千万日元就够了。

en: I feel completely refreshed after spending a week in the country.
zh: 在乡下待了一周，感觉整个人都神清气爽的。

en: I'll stay for a week.
The house collapsed a week later.
The house fell down a week later.
zh: 那房子一个星期后倒了。
